availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Montgomery (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, tailor. )

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, tailor. Native of Ireland. Married to Elizabeth Montgomery. Father of Mary A. Montgomery. Tailor in Louisville in 1860. Employed Mary Swartz as a servant in Louisville in 1860. Convicted of the murder of John Gibbs Jefferson Circuit Court in January 1863. Pardoned by Governor James F. Robinson in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 166.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Gillmans, p. 301B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY Roll 994041, Louisville Deaths, p. 224.
The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), January 15, 1863, p. 3.
The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), January 22, 1863, p. 1.
The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), January 24, 1863, p. 3.
